dcterms:creator: G. D. Konidaris
A. G. Barto
dcterms:description: PinBall is a continuous state domain where the agent must navigate a ball through a set of obstacles to reach the main goal, with a four-dimensional state space consisting of (x, y, ˙x, ˙y) positions and velocities.
dcterms:title: PinBall

dcterms:creator: G. D. Konidaris
A. G. Barto
dcterms:description: FourRooms is a grid world environment where the agent can choose from one of four actions in a discrete action space to navigate to a fixed goal state.
dcterms:title: FourRooms

dcterms:creator: G. D. Konidaris
A. G. Barto
dcterms:description: GridBall is a version of PinBall without velocity components, where the state consists only of (x, y) locations, and the action space displaces the ball by a fixed amount in each cardinal dimension.
dcterms:title: GridBall

dcterms:creator: C. Lo
K. Roice
P. M. Panahi
S. Jordan
A. White
G. Mihucz
F. Aminmansour
M. White
dcterms:description: Goal-Space Planning (GSP) is a framework that uses subgoal-conditioned models to improve value propagation and learning speed in reinforcement learning tasks.
dcterms:title: Goal-Space Planning (GSP)
